data.title: Season Wise FPL Dream Team From the 2002/03 FPL Season
data.meta_description: FPL Started in 2002/03 & in this blog let us take a look at the FPL Dream Team each season since FPL began.
data.meta_site_name: ALLABOUTFPL: Your one stop place for all FPL tips, FPL captain picks, FPL news, FPL players, previews, reviews,differential picks, analysis and weekly updates.
data.text:
FPL Started in 2002/03, throughout the years we have seen some amazing performances by players and in this blog let us take a look at the FPL Dream Team each season since FPL began to see the players who dominated FPL each season. There are some legendary names, some unknown gems from promoted teams in this list.

Link to all our FPL history blogs covering the highest-scoring players in a game week, all-time FPL dream team, season-wise dream teams from 2002/03 highest-scoring players each season, highest-scoring midfielders, defenders, forwards, goalkeepers, the origin of FPL, and more. Give them all a read if you’re interested to know what happened back in the days.

Season Wise Dream Team since 2002/03

2002/03 FPL Dream Team

Total points: 1975

Premier League Winners: Man United

Team Composition: Man United x4, Chelsea x2, Arsenal x1, Southampton x1, Leeds x1, Blackburn x1 & Liverpool x1

Most FPL points: Henry(271 points)

Most goals: Ruud van Nistelrooy(25 goals), 2nd: Henry(24 goals), 3rd: James Beattie(23 goals)

Most Assists: Henry(20 PL Assists)

Most Clean Sheets: Brad Friedel(15 clean sheets), Shay Given(14 clean sheets)

Star performer: Henry with 24 goals and 23 FPL assists(20 real assists)

Further Read: History Of Fantasy Football And Origin Of FPL

2003/04 FPL Dream Team

Total points: 2030

Premier League Winners: Arsenal(Invincible Season)

Team Composition: Man United x2, Chelsea x3, Arsenal x2, Newcastle x1, Fulham x2, & Liverpool x1

Most FPL points: Henry(242 points)

Most goals: Thierry Henry(30 goals), 2nd: Alan Shearer (24 goals), 3rd: Louis(20 goals, 13 for Fulham & 7 for Man United), Ruud van Nistelrooy(20 goals)

Most Assists: Muzzy Izzet for Leicester City(14 PL Assists)

Most Clean Sheets: Jens Lehmann(Arsenal) and Edwin Van der Sar(Fulham) with 15 Clean sheets

Henry once again dominated FPL in the famous Arsenal invincible season scoring a record 30 goals, Alan Shearer finished with 185 points and to date is the only Newcastle player to finish in the FPL dream team in 21 years of FPL.

Further Read: FPL History: Highest Scoring FPL Forwards Each Year Since The First FPL Season In 2002/03

2004/05 FPL Dream Team

Total points: 2018

Premier League Winners: Chelsea(Mourinho’s first season, 25 CS and just 15 goals conceded all season with only one loss)

Team Composition: Man United x1, Chelsea x5, Arsenal x2, Middlesbrough x1, Crystal Palace x1, & Liverpool x1

Most FPL Points: Lampard(269 points)

Most goals: Thierry Henry(25 goals), 2nd: A Johnson (21 goals), 3rd: Robert Piers(14 goals)

Most Assists: Lampard(18 PL Assists), Henry(14 PL assists), Bergkamp(12 PL assists)

Most Clean Sheets: Peter Cech 24 Clean sheets(Chelsea kept 25 CS but Cech missed one CS after he was out for the last three games)

Terry was the OG FPL defender having scored 196 points from an impressive 25 Clean sheets and 3 goals. Terry went close to becoming the 1st def to score 200+ pts, but didn’t play the last two games and Chelsea didn’t keep a CS in both the games. Had he played he could have become the first defender to cross 200 points, a milestone which was broken only in 2018/19 by VVD and Robbo.

Further Read: FPL History: Highest Scoring FPL Players Since The First FPL Season

2005/06 FPL Dream Team

Total points: 2049

Premier League Winners: Chelsea

Team Composition: Man United x3, Chelsea x3, Arsenal x1, Blackburn x1, Charlton Athletic x1, & Liverpool x2

Most FPL Points: Theirry Henry(239 points)

Most goals: Thierry Henry(27 goals), 2nd: Ruud Van Nistelrooy(21 goals), 3rd: Darren Bent(18 goals)

Most Assists: Drogba(11 PL Assists), Reyes(10 PL assists), Luis Morte(9 PL assists)

Most Clean Sheets: Pepe Reina(20 Clean sheets), Van Der Sar(18 Clean Sheets)

Another season dominated by Thierry Henry with 27 goals which made him the highest-scoring FPL player that season. He in fact finished as the highest-scoring FPL player in three of the first four FPL seasons.

2006/07 FPL Dream Team

Total points: 2004

Premier League Winners: Man United

Team Composition: Man United x2, Chelsea x2, Arsenal x1, Portsmouth x2, Everton x2, & Liverpool x2

Most FPL Points: Ronaldo(244 points)

Most goals: Drogba(20 goals), 2nd: Benni McCarthy(18 goals), 3rd: Ronaldo(17 goals)

Most Assists: Fabregas & Rooney(11 PL Assists), Lampard(10 PL assists), Arteta(9 PL assists)

Most Clean Sheets: Pepe Reina(19 Clean sheets), Howard(14 Clean Sheets)

Cristiano Ronaldo’s first PL Season and he ended up as the highest scoring FPL player which coincided with Man United winning the premier league. Portsmouth are the surprise team here with two Portsmouth players, Taylor and James in the dream team, Taylor played OOP in midfield registering 8 goals and 2 assists whereas James racked up an impressive 12 CS and a lot of save points.

2007/08 FPL Dream Team

Total points: 2138

Premier League Winners: Man United

Team Composition: Man United x2, Arsenal x2, Portsmouth x1, Aston Villa x2Everton x1, Blackburn x1 & Liverpool x2

Most FPL Points: Ronaldo(283 points)

Most goals: Ronaldo(31 goals), 2nd: Adebayor, Torres(24 goals), 3rd: Santa Cruz(19 goals)

Most Assists: Fabregas(17 PL Assists), Young(14 PL assists), Barry(10 PL assists)

Most Clean Sheets: Pepe Reina(18 Clean sheets), David James(16 Clean Sheets)

Another record-breaking season for Ronaldo which saw him win his first Ballon d’Or, Ronaldo scored a whopping 31 goals in one season which resulted in a 283 points FPL haul thanks to him being listed as a midfielder in FPL. Aston Villa did well that season with PL all-time appearance record holder Barry and Laursen both in the dream team.

Lescott matched Terry’s 196 points haul from an impressive eight goals and two assists along with 14 clean sheets. Another record-breaking defensive haul from back in the days.

Further Read: FPL History: Highest Scoring FPL Forwards Since the First FPL Season

2008/09 FPL Dream Team

Total points: 2033

Premier League Winners: Man United

Team Composition: Man United x2, Chelsea x3, Fulham x1, Aston Villa x1, Everton x1, & Liverpool x3

Most FPL Points: Lampard(226 points)

Most goals: Anekla(19 goals), 2nd: Ronaldo(18 goals), 3rd: Gerrard(16 goals)

Most Assists: Lampard&RVP(10 PL Assists), Berbatov, Gerrard, Stephan Ireland(9 PL assists), Fabregas, Milner, Malbranque, Kuyt(8 PL assists)

Most Clean Sheets: Edwin Van Der Sar(21 Clean sheets), Reina(20 Clean Sheets)

A low-scoring dream team with no FPL Forward scoring more than 200 points(One of the two only seasons like this) and the lowest top points for a forward in a season with Anelka scoring 179 points for Chelsea.

Man United went on a 14-game consecutive Cleansheet run(PL History) which meant Vidic racked up an impressive 187 points haul that season.

Further Read: FPL History: Highest Scoring FPL Midfielders since the first FPL season

2009/10 FPL Dream Team

Total points: 2167

Premier League Winners: Chelsea

Team Composition: Man United x2, Chelsea x4, Arsenal x1, Aston Villa x2, Man City x1, & Liverpool x1

Most FPL Points: Lampard(284 points)

Most goals: Drogba(29 goals), 2nd: Rooney(26 goals), 3rd: Darren Bent(24 goals)

Most Assists: Lampard(14 PL Assists), Fabregas(13 PL assists), Milner(12 PL assists)

Most Clean Sheets: Cech, Reina(17 Clean sheets), Friedel(15 Clean Sheets)

Lampard had a dream 2009/10 FPL season registering his highest ever FPL haul in his career with 284 points, one more than Ronaldo from the 2007/08 season. 22 goals, 14 assists to get 36 goal contributions in 36 games avg 1 return/game. Lampard also scored a whopping 28 points in one game against Aston Villa in a 7-1 win(4 goals and an assist). The highest FPL score in a single gameweek till Salah broke it against Watford with a 29-point haul.

Lampard finished as the highest points scorer three times on the game- 2004/05(269 points), 2008/09(226 points), 2009/10(284 points). Lampard finished as the highest scoring midfielder in the FPL game 5 times since FPL began in 2002/03.

Further Read: FPL History: Highest Scoring FPL Defenders Since The First FPL Season

2010/11 FPL Dream Team

Total points: 1947

Premier League Winners: Man United

Team Composition: Man United x2, Chelsea x3, Blackpool x1, Fulham x1, Everton x1, Man City x2, & Liverpool x1

Most FPL Points: Nani(198 points)

Most goals: Berbatov, Tevez(20 goals), 2nd: Robin Van Persie(18 goals), 3rd: Darren Bent(17 goals)

Most Assists: Nani (14 PL Assists), Drogba(13 PL assists), Arshavin(12 PL assists)

Most Clean Sheets: Joe Hart(18 Clean sheets), Cech(15 Clean Sheets), Reina(14 Clean Sheets)

The only season in which no player scored more than 200 points and the lowest FPL dream team total ever in the history of FPL.

Luis Nani finished as the best FPL player in the 2010/11 season. He had just 9 goals, but got 14 assists to ensure that he finished on top. Nani set up his team-mate Berbatov who scored 20 goals to help Manchester United win the league that season.

The runner-up spot that season was even more surprising with Charlie Adam from Blackpool getting 192 points courtesy of 12 goals and 8 assists.

Further Read: All Time FPL Dream Team Since The First Season in 2002/03 | FPL History

2011/12 FPL Dream Team

Total points: 2077

Premier League Winners: Man City

Team Composition: Man United x2, Spursx2, Arsenal x1, Fulham x1, Man City x4, & Liverpool x1

Most FPL Points: Robin Van Persie(269 points)

Most goals: Robin Van Persie(30 goals), 2nd: Rooney(27 goals), 3rd: Aguero(23 goals)

Most Assists: David Silva (14 PL Assists), Mata/Valencia(13 PL assists), Adebayor(11 PL assists)

Most Clean Sheets: Joe Hart(17 Clean sheets), Tim Krul(15 Clean Sheets), Brad Friedel(14 Clean Sheets)

Robin Van Persie was the highlight of the 2011/12 FPL Season with the Arsenal forward reaching the magical 30 PL goals mark in a single season. A certain Gareth Bale also made the dream team for the season.

RVP scored 30 goals, 13 assists(FPL) in 38 games- 43 goal contributions in 38 games along with 45 bonus points. Remarkably he didn’t even miss a single game that season.

RVP’s first goal of the 2011/12 season came in the third game of the season against Manchester United, scoring in an embarrassing 8-2 loss, regarded as one of the most one-sided games in the Premier League. This was also the last season for Van Persie for Arsenal as he moved to rivals Man United during the summer window before the 12/13 season.

Further Read: Most FPL Points Scored by Players in an FPL Gameweek | FPL History

2012/13 FPL Dream Team

Total points: 2154

Premier League Winners: Man United

Team Composition: Man United x2, Spurs x1, Arsenal x2, Chelsea x2, Swansea x1, Everton x1, Man City x1, & Liverpool x1

Most FPL Points: Robin Van Persie(262 points)

Most goals: Robin Van Persie(26 goals), 2nd: Luis Suarez(23 goals), 3rd: Bale(21 goals)

Most Assists: Juan Mata (12 PL Assists), Cazorla/Hazard (11 PL assists), Walcott/Rooney(10 PL assists)

Most Clean Sheets: Joe Hart(18 Clean sheets), Cech/Reina(14 Clean Sheets), Reina/Begovic(12 Clean Sheets)

Another season dominated by Robin Van Persie this time for Man United and he won the premier league too. Over the two seasons, Van Persie scored 56 goals and never missed a game across two seasons!

Bale’s 249 points haul(21 goals, 9 assists in 33 games) is also a remarkable one as the Welsh dragon showed the world his capabilities. He moved to Real Madrid in 2013 and later returned to Spurs on loan for the 2020/21 season.

Theo Walcott had a great season too and scored a hattrick plus two assists in a 7-3 win that season for a record 26 points haul.

Further Read: FPL History: Highest Scoring FPL Midfielders since the first FPL season

2013/14 FPL Dream Team

Total points: 2189

Premier League Winners: Man City

Team Composition: Man United x1, Chelsea x2, Southampton x1, Everton x3, Man City x1, & Liverpool x3

Most FPL Points: Luis Suarez(295 points)

Most goals: Suarez(31 goals), 2nd: Sturridge(21 goals), 3rd: Yaya Toure(20 goals)

Most Assists: Gerrard (13 PL Assists), Suarez (12 PL assists), Lambert/Rooney(10 PL assists)

Most Clean Sheets: Cech/Schezny(16 Clean sheets), Howard(15 Clean Sheets), Borc/Lloris(14 Clean Sheets)

Luis Suarez arguably had the best season any player has had in an FPL season. 295 points from 33 games without penalties is just bonkers. He averaged 8.9 points per game which is the highest ever points per game for a player in a season(Low mins not considered).

Suarez secured 31 goals, 25 assists(FPL), 40 bonus points during the season. His 295 points haul made him the highest-scoring FPL player in a season overtaking Lampard’s 284 points from the 2009/10 season. A record which later was claimed by King Mo!

Further Read: FPL Now vs Then | How Has FPL Evolved since the Early Years

2014/15 FPL Dream Team

Total points: 2031

Premier League Winners: Chelsea

Team Composition: Chelsea x3, Arsenal x2, Everton x1, Swansea x1, QPR x1, Spurs x1, Man City x2,

Most FPL Points: Hazard (233 points)

Most goals: Aguero(26 goals), 2nd: Kane(21 goals), 3rd: Costa(20 goals)

Most Assists: Fabregas (18 PL Assists), Cazorla (11 PL assists), Brunt/Di Maria/Sigurdson(10 PL assists)

Most Clean Sheets: Hart(14 Clean sheets), Fabianzski/Forster/Mignolet(13 Clean Sheets), Courtois(12 Clean Sheets)

A remarkable season for strikers which saw Kane score 21 goals at just 5 Million. Hazard top-scored in FPL with a 233-point FPL campaign. Charlie Austin enjoyed a brilliant campaign too registering 176 FPL points from 18 goals and 7 assists.

Further Read: FPL History: Highest Scoring FPL Midfielders since the first FPL season

2015/16 FPL Dream Team

Total points: 2046

Premier League Winners: Leicester City

Team Composition: Leicester City x2, Arsenal x4, Everton x1, Swansea x1, Spurs x3

Most FPL Points: Mahrez (240 points)

Most goals: Kane(25 goals), 2nd: Aguero/Vardy(21 goals), 3rd: Lukaku(18 goals)

Most Assists: Ozil (19 PL Assists), Eriksen (13 PL assists), Payet/Tadic(12 PL assists)

Most Clean Sheets: Cech(16 Clean sheets), De Gea/Hart/Schmeichel(15 Clean Sheets), Lloris(13 Clean Sheets)

A PL season that will be remembered for a long time saw Leicester City win the Premier League with Riyad Mahrez top-scoring in FPL with a 240 points haul(17 goals, 11 assists, 38 bonus points, and 240 points in total.

Mahrez started the season at a very low price of 5.5 due to just 4 goals & 5 assists in the previous season.

However, Mahrez started the season in amazing fashion smashing 5 double-digit hauls in the first 6 weeks courtesy 5 goals and 3 assists. His price rose to 6.5 by GW8. He blanked just two times between GW9 & GW17 and reached his peak price of 7.4 by GW30.

Ozil also had one of his best season as a player for Arsenal registering 19 assists just one less than the record of Henry and KDB who have had 20 PL assists in one season of the Premier League.

Further Read: List of FPL Winners Since The First FPL Season in 2002/03

2016/17 FPL Dream Team

Total points: 2249

Premier League Winners: Chelsea

Team Composition: Chelsea x 4 Burnley x1, Arsenal x1, Everton x1, Man City x1, Spurs x3

Most FPL Points: Sanchez (264 points)

Most goals: Kane(29 goals), 2nd: Lukaku(25 goals), 3rd: Sanchez(24 goals)

Most Assists: Kevin De Bruyne (18 PL Assists), Eriksen (15 PL assists), Sigurdson(13 PL assists)

Most Clean Sheets: Courtois(16 Clean sheets), Lloris(15 Clean Sheets), De Gea/Forster(14 Clean Sheets)

The first time the entire dream team defence is from one team, Chelsea. But the FPL Season was dominated by Alexis Sanchez who scored a whopping 24 goals, 11 assists, and 32 bonus points accumulating to a total of 264 points. The double gameweek 37 of the 2016/17season is particularly famous with Kane and Sanchez the popular triple captain choices, Sanchez scored 27 points but Kane bettered it with 31 points.

Further Read: FPL History: Highest Scoring FPL Midfielders since the first FPL season

2017/18 FPL Dream Team

Total points: 2203

Premier League Winners: Man City

Team Composition: Chelsea x 2, Man United x1, Leicester x2, Liverpool x1, Man City x3, Spurs x2

Most FPL Points: Salah (303 points)

Most goals: Salah(32 goals), 2nd:Kane (30 goals), 3rd: Aguero(21 goals)

Most Assists: Kevin De Bruyne (16 PL Assists), Sane (15 PL assists), Sterling/David Silva(13 PL assists)

Most Clean Sheets: De Gea(18 Clean sheets), Ederson(16 Clean Sheets), Courtois/Lloris(15 Clean Sheets)

Mo Salah season. The only player to score more than 300 points in an FPL season. Salah started the season at only 9 Million and scored 32 goals, the most scored by a player since FPL began, and registered 12 assists averaging 8.4 points per game totaling 303 points. Salah had a double-digit haul 15 times in that season including a 29 points haul in a SINGLE game vs Watford scoring four goals and assisting the other in a 5-0 win.

Kane had a sensational season too hitting 30 goals for Spurs and totaling 217 FPL Points.

Further Read: Most FPL Points Scored by Players in an FPL Gameweek | FPL History

2018/19 FPL Dream Team

Total points: 2332

Premier League Winners: Man City

Team Composition: Liverpool x6, Chelsea x 1, Everton x1, Arsenal x1, Man City x2,

Most FPL Points: Salah (259 points)

Most goals: Aubameyang/Mane/Salah(22 goals), 2nd:Aguero (21 goals), 3rd: Vardy(18 goals)

Most Assists: Hazard (15 PL Assists), Fraser(14 PL assists), Trent/Eriksen(12 PL assists)

Most Clean Sheets: Alisson (21 Clean sheets), Ederson(20 Clean Sheets), Kepa/Pickford(14 Clean Sheets)

The highest FPL dream team score and the only time there are six players from the same team in the FPL dream history. Liverpool dominated FPL in 2018/19 only to agonizingly fall close to winning their first Premier League title. Salah finished as the highest-scoring player for the second season running finishing with a 259-point haul with 22 goals.

Further Read: Number of People Who Played FPL Each Season | How Many Play FPL?

2019/20 FPL Dream Team

Total points: 2263

Premier League Winners: Liverpool

Team Composition: Liverpool x5, Leicester x 1, Burnley x1, Man United x1, Arsenal x1, Man City x2,

Most FPL Points: Kevin De Bruyne (251 points)

Most goals: Vardy(23 goals), 2nd: Aubameyang/Ings (22 goals), 3rd: Sterling(20 goals)

Most Assists: KDB (20 PL Assists/23 FPL Assists), Trent Alexander Arnold(13 PL assists), Robertson(12 PL assists)

Most Clean Sheets: Ederson (15 Clean sheets), Pope(14 Clean Sheets), Alisson/De Gea/Rui Patricio/Dean Henderson/Schmeichel(13 Clean Sheets)

A season that was hampered by Covid saw Liverpool win their first PL title with another dominant performance. Liverpool assets ruled FPL with 5 Liverpool players in the dream team. However, it was not Salah but KDB who finished the season as the highest-scoring player having matched Henry’s record of 20 PL assists/23 FPL assists from the very first FPL season in 2002/03.

Further Read: Top 10 FPL Hauls from 2021/22 FPL Season | Single & Double Gameweek

2020/21 FPL Dream Team

Total points: 2180

Premier League Winners: Man City

Team Composition: Liverpool x4, Man United x1, Leicester x 1, Leeds x2, Spurs x2, Aston Villa x1

Most FPL Points: Bruno Fernandes (244 points)

Most goals: Kane(23 goals), 2nd: Salah(22 goals), 3rd: Bruno(18 goals)

Most Assists: Kane (14 PL Assists), Bruno Fernandes(12 PL assists), Grealish/Heung Min Son(10 PL assists)

Most Clean Sheets: Ederson (19 Clean sheets), Mendy(16 Clean Sheets), Martinez(15 Clean Sheets)

Harry Kane finished the season with the most goals and assists for his best FPL season of 242 points, Bruno however edged Kane by 2 points to finish as the highest-scoring FPL player in 2020/21. Stuard Dallas who played out of position as a midfielder finished as the highest-scoring defender above TAA and Robertson.

Emi Martinez meanwhile came very close to beating the record set by Brad Friedel for the most FPL points by a goalkeeper. He missed out by just one point in the end, in the last game against Chelsea, Villa and Martinez were keeping a CS but conceded a goal in the end which meant Friedel’s record from 2002/03 wasn’t bettered.

Further Read: Most FPL Points Scored by Players in an FPL Gameweek | FPL History

2021/22 FPL Dream Team

Total points: 2254

Premier League Winners: Man City

Team Composition: Liverpool x6, West Ham x1, Man City x 2, Spurs x2

Most FPL Points: Salah (265 points)

Most goals: Salah/Son(23 goals), 2nd: Ronaldo(18 goals), 3rd: Kane(17 goals)

Most Assists: Salah (13 PL Assists), Trent Alexander Arnold(12 PL assists), Barnes/Bowen/Mount/Robertson(10 PL assists)

Most Clean Sheets: Alisson/Ederson (20 Clean sheets), Lloris(16 Clean Sheets), Mendy(14 Clean Sheets)

A season that saw so many blanks and doubles meant the dream team score was high but not higher than the 2332 from the 18/19 season. Salah finished top for goals and assists with Son matching Salah for goals. Salah once looked to better his 303 points record but eventually settled for a 265 points haul after missing a few games due to AFCON and his form taking a drop post AFCON.

Bowen had a stellar season with 206 points for West Ham starting the season at just 6.5 million. Cancelo also became the first non-liverpool defender to cross 200+ points in a single FPL season.

2022/23 FPL Dream Team

Total points: 2267

Premier League Winners: Man City

Team Composition: Liverpool x2, Man United x 1, Newcastle x 1, Brentford x 1, Arsenal x4, Man City x 1, Spurs 1

Most FPL Points: Haaland (272 points)

Most goals: Haaland(36 goals), 2nd: Kane(30 goals), 3rd: Toney(20 goals)

Most Assists: KDB (18 FPL Assists), Trossard/Salah(13 PL assists), Saka/Gibbs White/Mahrez(12 PL assists)

Most Clean Sheets: De Gea (17 Clean sheets), Ramsdale/Alisson/Pope (12 Clean Sheets), Raya(12 Clean Sheets)

2023/24 FPL Dream Team

Total points: 2217

Premier League Winners: Man City

Team Composition: Arsenal*4, Man City*2, Liverpool*1, Everton*1, Tottenham*1, Aston Villa*1, Chelsea*1

Most FPL Points: Palmer(244 points)

Most goals: Haaland(27 goals), 2nd: Palmer(22 goals), 3rd: Isak(21 goals)

Most Assists: Watkins (18 FPL Assists), Gordon(16 FPL assists), Palmer(13 FPL assists)

Most Clean Sheets: Raya (16 Clean sheets), Pickford (13 Clean Sheets), Ederson(11 Clean Sheets)

All Time FPL Dream Team(2002/03 to 2023/24)

All time FPL Dream Team Starting 11: Friedel, Trent Alexander Arnold, Virjil Van Dijk, Andy Robertson, Mo Salah, Frank Lampard, Cristiano Ronaldo, Alexis Sanchez, Luis Suarez. Robin Van Persie, Thierry Henry. Subs: Emi Martinez, Son, Cancelo, Trippier.

All Time FPL Dream Team Detailed Blog with stats & hauls for each player

FPL has been around for a long time, in this blog let’s take a look at the all-time FPL dream team since the first FPL season in 2002/03

Players with the most dream team appearances:

Here is a list of players with at least 4 FPL dream team appearances.
